src.data.features.team_stats

Helper functions for building engineered features for team stats.

src.data.features.team_stats.adjust_for_opponent(base, opponent)[source]

Adjust base data for opponent strength.

Parameters:

  • base (pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, n_features)) – Base data to adjust. Must have season/team/week/opponent multiindex.

  • opponent (pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, n_features)) – Opponent data to use for adjustment. Must have season/team/week/opponent multiindex.

Returns:

Adjusted data.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, n_features)

src.data.features.team_stats.aggregate_efficiency_stats(games, raw_plays_path, output_dir)[source]

Make efficiency stats (e.g. EPA, WPA, etc.) for each team and week.

Parameters:

  • games (pd.DataFrame of shape (n_games, n_features)) – Game data.

  • raw_plays_path (str) – Path to raw play-by-play data.

  • output_dir (str) – Path to directory to write output to.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

src.data.features.team_stats.assemble_play_type_features(pbp_data, type_aggs_pairs)[source]

Assemble features for each play type.

Parameters:

  • pbp_data (pd.DataFrame of shape (n_plays, n_features)) – Play-by-play data for a given season.

  • type_aggs_pairs (list[tuple]) – List of tuples of the form (play_type, aggregations) where play_type is a string and aggregations is a dictionary of aggregations to calculate for each feature.

Returns:

Aggregated data for each team and week.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, n_features)

src.data.features.team_stats.build_team_stats_features(raw_games_path, raw_plays_path, output_dir)[source]

Build engineered features for team stats.

Parameters:

  • raw_games_path (str) – Path to raw game data.

  • raw_plays_path (str) – Path to raw play-by-play data.

  • output_dir (str) – Path to directory to write output to.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

src.data.features.team_stats.calculate_avgs(points, window)[source]

Calculate averages per team per week per season with expanding or rolling windows.

Parameters:

  • points (pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, n_features)) – Points for/against indexed by season, team, and week.

  • window (int) – Number of weeks to use for rolling averages.

Returns:

Points per game averages indexed by season, team, and week.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, n_features)

src.data.features.team_stats.calculate_squad_aggs(plays, aggregations, squad_type, play_type)[source]

Calculate aggregations per team, squad, and week.

Given a set of play-by-play data: - group all plays by team

  • for each group, calculate the aggs for each play using all data up to that play

  • now group by team and week and take the last row for each week

  • shift the data down one row so that the stats for each week only go up to the end of the previous week

  • format things

NOTE: aggregations must have ‘week’:’max’ as a key-value pair

Parameters:

  • plays (pd.DataFrame of shape (n_plays, n_features)) – Play-by-play data.

  • aggregations (dict) – Aggregations to calculate.

  • squad_type (str) – Squad type to aggregate by (e.g. posteam, defteam).

  • play_type (str) – Play type to aggregate by (e.g. pass, rush).

Returns:

Aggregated data.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, n_features)

src.data.features.team_stats.flatten_columns(df)[source]

Flatten the multi-level columns of an aggregation dataframe.

Parameters:

df (pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, n_features)) – Aggregations result with multi-index columns.

Returns:

Aggregations with flattened columns.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, n_features)

src.data.features.team_stats.flip_defense_stat_signs(d_stats, stats_to_flip)[source]

Flip the sign on certain defensive stats (e.g. EPA) for which negative values are good.

Use regex to find columns with names that contain any of the strings in stats_to_flip. Multiply those columns by -1.

Parameters:

  • d_stats (pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, n_features)) – Aggregated defensive stats returned by calculate_squad_aggs.

  • stats_to_flip (list[str]) – Strings to use for regex matching. Each element should take the form ‘_statname_’.

Returns:

Defensive stats with signs flipped.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, n_features)

src.data.features.team_stats.make_base_points_data(games)[source]

Build base points data (e.g. points for and against) for feature creation.

Parameters:

games (pd.DataFrame of shape (n_games, n_features)) – Raw games data.

Returns:

Points for/against indexed by season, team, and week.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, 5)

src.data.features.team_stats.make_points_features(games, window, output_dir)[source]

Build all points features (e.g. net points).

Parameters:

  • games (pd.DataFrame of shape (n_games, n_features)) – Raw games data.

  • window (int) – Number of weeks to use for rolling averages.

  • output_dir (str) – Directory to write csv files to.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

src.data.features.team_stats.reframe_team_as_opponent(df)[source]

Transform a df index such that ‘team’ is now ‘opponent’.

Parameters:

df (pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, n_features)) – Dataframe with season/team/week multiindex.

Returns:

Dataframe with season/opponent/week multiindex.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, n_features)

src.data.features.team_stats.write_cols_to_file(features, output_dir)[source]

Write each feature to a separate csv file.

Parameters:

  • features (pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, n_features)) – Engineered features. Must have columns ‘team’, ‘week’, and ‘season’.

  • output_dir (str) – Directory to write csv files to.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None
